value.title: Incremental Refresh with Integers in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do you use integer date keys with Incremental Refresh in Power BI??? Patrick walks you through how to do it.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-incremental-refresh  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/increfreshsample  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Is your Power BI visualization misleading?
value.excerpt: Your Power BI visualization should communicate accurate information. However, you may be misleading your audience. Take care in what you are putting on your reports.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/misleadingvisualsample  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Let's Talk Paginated Reports In Power BI (Premium)

value.title: Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick introduces the Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh. This is the MEQM! A report that can be useful to see SQL Server queries that Power BI issues during refresh.  MEQM Files - https://github.com/guyinacube/demo-files/tree/master/video%20demos/MEQM  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: Power BI: Case of the unexplained date (LastDate in DAX)
value.excerpt: Adam looks at why the LastDate DAX function is returning the wrong date within Power BI Desktop. Breaking down a twitter conversation. value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers

We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

Adam jumps in to show you what the connection string looks like when you use this approach.  Configure Read-Only

value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release.  I walk through how you could can configure this now in Power BI Desktop. I also talk about some of the limitations.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in

value.title: SQL Service Principal Names
value.excerpt: A look at how the SQL SPN's should be formatted and how they get generated.  This was based on an older blog I had published and I still get a lot of questions on this.  What SPN do I use and how does it get there? - http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2010/03/09/what-spn-do-i-use-and-how-does-it-get-there.aspx

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/
